head.supplied: 10/4/88. ¶ ¶ With the finish of the Key, ¶ esteemed Mr Tepper, whilst the Goodeniaceae are going through the press I also have critically studied with my now extensive material another couple of dou...

div.p: RB MSS M198, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.
MS annotation by Tepper: 'Reply & Letter to Sec. Roy. Soc. Tasm. 16.4.88'. Letter not found. 10/4/88.

p.seg: Bei der Beendigung des Key, geehrter Herr Tepper, habe ich, während die Goodeniaceen durch die Presse gehen, auch noch ein paar fragliche Arten kritisch nach meinem nun weit-reichenden Material studirt, und bin so auch zu der Pflanze gekommen, welche Sie mir vor Jahren als Goodenia 278 sandten. Ich habe diese Pflanze auch von Prof Tate, u in der That dieselbe Art in Frucht 1848 am Murray Flusse u 1851 am Flinders Range selbst gesammelt. Bentham hat sie eingeschlossen unter die Formen von G. pinnatifida; aber obgleich ich ein paar Mittelformen habe, die

sein mögen, halte ich sie doch für eine selbstständige Species, u habe sie nun in den Key unter dem vor vielen Jahren gegebenen Namen G. pusilliflora aufgenommen. Das Indusium ist merkwürdig, u erinnert etwas an Calogyne. Ich machte darüber vor 10 Jahren ein Notiz am Lachlan River, u Prof Tate hat auch eine Bemerkung auf seinem Zettel darüber geliefert. Ich habe das kleine aber niedliche Gewächs nun von 8 Sammlern; ich selbst nur habe die Notiz, dass es auf halbsalzigem Boden vorkommen. Stimmt das mit Ihren Beobachtungen auf York's peninsula überein?
ist, Ihrer Royal Society vorlegen, falls Gelegenheit für baldige Veröffentlichung da ist; sonst kann die Description hier im Vict. Naturalist gedruckt werden.
Meetings für die Centennial Exhib. gehen, alles an einem Tage,
giebt Ihnen eine Idee wie bedrängt ich eben

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Ich möchte Ihnen rathen mit der R.S. of Tasm sich direct in Verbindung zu setzen wegen der von mir für Sie dahin gesandten Abhandlung.

With the finish of the Key,
B88.11.02, p. 354. esteemed Mr Tepper, whilst the Goodeniaceae are going through the press I also have critically studied with my now extensive material another couple of doubtful species and so have also come to the plant that you sent me years ago as Goodenia 278. I have this plant also from Professor Tate and in fact collected the same species in fruit myself in 1848 on the Murray River and in 1851 in the Flinders Ranges.
SA. Bentham has included it among the forms of G. pinnatifida,
Bentham (1863-78), vol. 4, p. 75. but although I have a couple of intermediate forms that may be hybrids , I do regard it as a separate species, and have now included it in the Key under the name G. pusilliflora that was given many years ago.
It is evident from M's description in B88.05.02 that it was a herbarium name, not previously published. The earliest dated specimen, MEL23152, was collected by M near the Flinders Ranges, SA, in 1851, and includes the name on his original label (the sheet also has one of M's Phytological Museum of Melbourne labels that must have been completed later). A specimen collected by M on the Lachlan River in September 1878 with that name on his label is at Kew, K215876, but the received date is unclear. The indusium is strange and recalls somewhat Calogyne . I made a note about it 10 years ago on the Lachlan River,
NSW. and Professor Tate has also provided a comment about it on his label. I have the small, but pretty, plant now from eight collectors; I myself have only the note that it occurs on half salty soil. Does that agree with your observations on Yorke Peninsula
SA. ?

I could submit the description, which is ready , to your Royal Society, if there is opportunity for rapid publication there, otherwise the description can be printed here in the Victorian Naturalist.
The description of G. pusilliflora was published in the Victorian journal; see B88.05.02.

Tomorrow I must go to four meetings for the Centennial Exhibition,
Centennial International Exhibition, Melbourne, 1888-9. all in one day, that gives you an idea how pressed I am just now!

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p:
I would like to advise you to put yourself directly in communication with the Secretary of the Royal Society of Tasmania about the paper sent by me there for you.
See M to O. Tepper, 28 January 1888, and M to O. Tepper, 3 February 1888 (in this edition as 88-02-03a).
